title: Accessibility guidelines for forms
description: Detailed accessibility requirements and implementation guidance for forms on VA.gov.

frontMatter.title: Accessibility guidelines for forms
frontMatter.description: Detailed accessibility requirements and implementation guidance for forms on VA.gov.
frontMatter.intro: This template provides detailed accessibility requirements and implementation guidance for forms on VA.gov, ensuring Veterans with disabilities can access and complete essential services. Approximately 1 in 4 Veterans live with service-connected disabilities.

when_to_use.value: **All form implementations.** These guidelines apply to all forms on VA.gov.
**Section 508 compliance.** Forms must comply with Section 508 and Americans with Disabilities Act requirements.
**Universal usability.** Addresses technical accessibility, cognitive accessibility, and universal usability principles.

structure.intro: The guidelines cover focus management, form labeling, validation, cognitive accessibility, and testing requirements.

sections.title: Managing Focus in Form Flows
sections.description: Single-page applications must manually set focus when users move between pages since focus doesn't reset automatically.

sections.title: Where to Move Focus
sections.description: If page has unique heading (H1 or H3), set focus there. Without unique heading, set focus on step indicator header (H2).

sections.title: Form Labeling and Structure
sections.description: Each form step needs unique H3 describing current step. Use consistent fieldset/legend patterns across all steps.

sections.title: Input Validation and Error Handling
sections.description: Validate required fields when users attempt to continue. Move focus to first field with error. Preserve all user data when validation errors occur.

sections.title: Cognitive Accessibility
sections.description: Present one question per page, show clear progress indication, use consistent terminology, include review pages for important submissions.

sections.title: Comprehensive Accessibility Testing
sections.description: Keyboard navigation, screen reader testing, error message association, proper labeling, color contrast verification.

content_guidelines.value: **Focus testing checklist.** Does focus land on unique heading after clicking Continue? Is focused item visible? Does screen reader immediately announce step/page name?
**Error messages.** Provide specific, actionable error messages in plain language. Example: 'Enter a valid 9-digit Social Security number' rather than 'Invalid input'.
**Cognitive design.** Present one question per page, show clear progress, use consistent terminology, provide format examples.

accessibility.value: **WCAG 2.4.3 Focus Order.** Focus moves in a logical sequence that preserves meaning and operability.
**WCAG 2.4.7 Focus Visible.** Keyboard focus indicator must be visible.
**WCAG 3.3.2 Labels/Instructions.** Labels or instructions are provided when content requires user input.
**WCAG 3.3.3 Error Suggestion.** Correction suggestions provided for detected errors.
**WCAG 4.1.3 Status Messages.** Form validation changes must be programmatically determinable.
**Required testing areas.** Keyboard navigation, screen reader testing (NVDA, JAWS, VoiceOver), error message association, proper labeling, color contrast.
**Multi-step specific testing.** Screen reader announcements for step changes, progress bar updates, focus movement after error correction, session persistence.
**Foundational testing before launch.** Color and contrast evaluation, automated testing with aXe DevTools, content zoom and reflow, keyboard navigation.
**Support available.** The Accessibility Digital Experience (ADE) team provides early guidance during planning phases.
